title.gco:CharacterString: Coal Fields of the United States

organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States
Eastern Energy Resource Surveys Team (Geological Survey)

otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: These data were downloaded from the National Atlas website (http://www.nationalatlas.gov/atlasftp.html) in August 2014.

collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States of America, 1997-2014

abstract.gco:CharacterString: This polygon shapefile shows the coal fields of Alaska and the conterminous United States. Most of the material for the conterminous United States was collected from James Trumbull's "Coal Fields of the United States, Conterminous United States" map (sheet 1, 1960). The Gulf Coast region was updated using generalized, coal-bearing geology obtained from State geologic maps. The Alaska coal fields were collected from Farrell Barnes's "Coal Fields of the United States, Alaska" map (sheet 2, 1961). This layer is part of the 1997-2014 edition National Atlas of the United States.

purpose.gco:CharacterString: These data are intended for geographic display and analysis at the National level, and for large regional areas. The data should be displayed and analyzed at scales appropriate for 1:5,000,000-scale data. No responsibility is assumed by the U.S. Geological Survey or the National Atlas of the United States in the use of these data.

credit.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States. (2001). Coal Fields of the United States. National Atlas of the United States. Available at: http://purl.stanford.edu/xj766ny6798.

fileDescription.gco:CharacterString: This is a simplified GIF image of the coal fields in the conterminous United States.

title.gco:CharacterString: Geologic Names Unit Lexicon (GNULEX), 1996; Stratigraphic Nomenclature Databases for the United States, Its Possessions, and Territories; U.S. Geological Survey Digital Data Series DDS-6, release 3.

useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Geological Survey, no warranty expressed or implied is made by the U.S. Geological Survey regarding the utility of the data on any other system, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. No responsibility is assumed by the U.S. Geological Survey in the use of these data.

otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This item is in the public domain.

title.gco:CharacterString: Feature Catalog for Coal Fields of the United States

organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Eastern Energy Resource Surveys Team (Geological Survey)

measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: Topology for this map layer was built using the CLEAN command within Arc/INFO. This command eliminates dangling nodes, calculates intersections of arcs, eliminates redundant arcs, and creates a polygon attribute table.
This map layer is a representation of the coal fields in the conterminous United States and Alaska. There are no coal fields in Hawaii.

description.gco:CharacterString: All the paper maps were manually digitized on a tablet using Arc/INFO. All data were then appended into one data set. This data set was edited to resolve inconsistencies between maps and to form a polygon coverage. The final data set was then attributed using the coaltype codes described within this document.
Some arcs in Alaska, Florida, Michigan, Oregon, Rhode Island, Texas, and Washington were adjusted to align with the National Atlas shoreline.
The polygon coverage was converted to a shapefile.
Coal province and coal field/region name attributes were added to polygons based on the CF1960 and CF1961 maps. One additional name was obtained from State coal field summaries in KEYSTONE.
